contentrichtext.text: {{about|a building in Boston|he second-tallest building in Providence|One Financial Plaza}} {{Infobox building |name = One Financial Center |image = One Financial Center (Boston) - SA06940.JPG |image_size = 275px |location = One Financial Center, [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]], [[Massachusetts]], 02111 |latd = 42| latm = 21| lats = 08.6| latNS = N |longd = 71| longm = 03| longs = 23.0| longEW = W |iso_region = US-MA_scale:2000 |coordinates_display= title |antenna_spire = {{convert|683|ft|m|abbr=on}} |roof = {{convert|590|ft|m|abbr=on}} |floor_count = 46 |completion_date = 1983 |building_type = Office |architect = [[Pietro Belluschi]] |developer = [[Metropolitan Life Insurance Company]] }} '''One Financial Center''' is a modern [[skyscraper]] adjacent to [[Dewey Square]] in the [[Financial District, Boston, Massachusetts|Financial District]] of [[Boston, Massachusetts]]. Built in 1983, it is Boston's [[List of tallest buildings in Boston|7th-tallest building]], standing 590 feet (180 meters) tall, and housing 46 floors. An unusual 90 ft (27 m) tall glass-roofed lobby, known as the [[Atrium (architecture)|atrium]], occupies the first two stories. The remaining stories are offices, home to a number of [[law firms]], [[Certified Public Accountant]]s, and financial services companies. The building is located on a historic 1.23-acre (5000 mÂ²) triangular piece of land next to [[South Station (Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority)|South Station]] and the [[Federal Reserve Bank Building (Boston)|Federal Reserve Bank Building]], joining the [[Fort Point Channel]] area with Boston's Financial District. During the [[Big Dig (Boston, Massachusetts)|Big Dig]] (a project to create a new underground highway under the centre of Boston), extra care was needed to avoid [[subsidence]] of the soil under the building, as construction was underway just 25 ft (7.6 m) from the building's foundation. The building was constructed on soil rather than [[bedrock]] due to the geography of the site. The tower is topped off by two [[Radio masts and towers|radio masts]]. Including its radio masts, One Financial Center is the [[List of tallest buildings in Boston#Listing by Pinnacle Height|3rd-tallest building]] in Boston (when measuring by pinnacle height), rising 683 feet (208 meters). Apart from the masts and their supporting [[guy-wire|cables]], the roof of the building is flat with no crown. ==Tenants== *[[EverBank]] *[[HarbourVest Partners]] *[[Loomis, Sayles & Company]] *[[Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky, and Popeo]] *[[Gemvara]] ==See also== {{Commons category|One Financial Center}} *[[List of tallest buildings in Boston]] ==External links== *[http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id=1financialcenter-boston-ma-usa Emporis.com] {{Boston skyscrapers}} {{Everbank}} [[Category:Skyscrapers in Boston, Massachusetts]] [[Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1983]] [[Category:Skyscrapers between 150 and 199 meters]] [[Category:Jung Brannen buildings]] [[Category:Pietro Belluschi buildings]] [[Category:Office buildings in Boston, Massachusetts]] [[Category:EverBank]]
